challenges.name: What is Coding
challenges.description: Coding otherwise known as programming is an idea about telling a computer what to do. Everything that you see on your screen whether that is your phone or your computer has computer code running beneath it which tells the computer what to do. There are a lot of different types of programming like embedded programming which works on things like the operating system, or web development which works on things like websites, similar to this one.

challenges.name: Add a Variable
challenges.description: In computer programming, variables are used to store information to be referenced later. For example you can use the variable block and make a variable. Name it x and set it too 3.

tests.text: add a variable x and set it too 3

hints: First try adding a variable block set it to x
Make sure that you set the variable to 3

challenges.name: Print variable
challenges.description: Another part of programming is printing our output. Below, there is a console which can be used to print text, or things such as variables. Use the print function and print x, and you will then see the output of the variable in the console.
hints: Use a print function to output the variable x

challenges.name: Functions
challenges.description: Functions are another big part of programming, it can be thought of a block of code that can be called. This makes the code reusable as you can call it more than once as well as keep code separated and better. Make a function using the function block and call it z. Inside it, make a variable y and set it to some text. Then print the variable inside of the function.

tests.text: make a function put a variable and print it
tests.test: assert(code[0], 'z'); assert(code[6], 'functionblock'); assert(code[1], 'y'); lengthfunc(code[2], 0); assert(code[3], 'variablefunction'); lengthfunc(code[4], 0); assert(code[5], 'printfunction');

hints: Use a function and call it z
Inside the function make a variable set it to y and put some text

challenges.name: Call the function
challenges.description: The beauty of a function is how you can call it whenever you want. You can call function z now. Try using a call function and call it to see the print function return a value.

tests.test: assert(code[0], 'z'); assert(code[6], 'functionblock'); assert(code[1], 'y'); lengthfunc(code[2], 0); assert(code[3], 'variablefunction'); lengthfunc(code[4], 0); assert(code[5], 'printfunction'); assert(code[9], 'callfunctionblock'); assert(code[7], 'z')

hints: Use the call function block to call the function z

challenges.name: Add arguments to function
challenges.description: You can add arguments to functions, when you call the function next to the name you can add variables that you can then use in your code and assign it to a value when you call the function. Add an argument next to the function name, use it when you call print inside the function.

tests.text: add an argument to the function

challenges.name: Use the argument
challenges.description: Now when you call the function next to the name that you want to call you can also add any text that you want and that would be passed down to the function as an argument. You can set it to whatever text you want and our function would print it. Call the function and type up whatever text you want to add.

challenges.name: If statements
challenges.description: Similar to a yes or no question, an if statement has a instruction say it can check if a variable is equal to text. If that is true, a block of code would get executed and if it is false nothing would be executed. Try making an if statement and printing a number to the console.

challenges.name: Else Statements
challenges.description: If the if statement returns false, then you can also execute whatever code you want with an else statement. Add it to the end of an if statement and return text. Now, if the condition returns false, that text would get returned in the console.

challenges.name: Conclusion
challenges.description: Now that we have finished learning about the fundamentals of coding and how it is used we can start learning about machine learning in the next section.
